title: Venetian Prealps
text:
The Venetian Prealps ("Prealpi Venete" in <a href="Italian%20language">Italian</a>) are a mountain range in the south-eastern part of the <a href="Alps">Alps</a>. They are located in <a href="Triveneto">Triveneto</a>, in the north-eastern part of <a href="Italy">Italy</a>.
Geography.
Administratively the range is divided between the <a href="Provinces%20of%20Italy">Italian provinces</a> of <a href="Province%20of%20Trento">Trento</a> (in the <a href="regions%20of%20Italy">Region</a> of <a href="Trentino%20Alto%20Adige">Trentino Alto Adige</a>), <a href="Province%20of%20Verona">Verona</a>, <a href="Province%20of%20Vicenza">Vicenza</a>, <a href="Province%20of%20Treviso">Treviso</a>, <a href="Province%20of%20Belluno">Belluno</a> (in the <a href="regions%20of%20Italy">Region</a> of <a href="Veneto">Veneto</a>) and <a href="Province%20of%20Pordenone">Pordenone</a> (in the <a href="regions%20of%20Italy">Region</a> of <a href="Friuli%20Venezia%20Giulia">Friuli Venezia Giulia</a>).
The Venetian Prealps are drained by the rivers <a href="Adige">Adige</a>, <a href="Brenta%20%28river%29">Brenta</a>, <a href="Piave%20%28river%29">Piave</a> and other minor rivers and streams, all of them <a href="tributaries">tributaries</a> of the <a href="Adriatic%20sea">Adriatic sea</a>.
